required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Altering Toenail Biomechanic in Managing Ingrown Toenail.
clinical_study.official_title: Altering Toenail Biomechanic in Managing Ingrown Toenail.Randomized Clinical Trial.

brief_summary.textblock: Ingrown toenail is commonly met in clinical practice.treatment may be non-operative and operative treatment.operative trestment depends on lateral wedge resection of the nail. The idea is to change toenail biomechanics by central toenail resection.

detailed_description.textblock: The aim of this study is to compare between central toenail resection with ordinary lateral wedge resection in managing ingrown toenail. This study was performed on 100 patients divided into 2 groupd each is 50 patients. Group A underwent central resection while group B underwent lateral toenail resection.

primary_outcome.measure: Postoperative pain on visual analog score for pain
primary_outcome.description: All patients are pain free after 5 days postoperative

secondary_outcome.description: Recurrence is followed up by asking the patient to follow up in outpatient clinic after six month and also,by calling the patients in telephone.

arm_group.description: Under local ring anaesthesua using xylocaine injection in base of big toe ,Surgical resection of the central part of toenail with underlying germinal matrix.the defect is sutures by prolene.
Under local ring anaesthesiausing xylocaine injection around the base of big toe. Resect lateral wedge of toenail with removal of ingrown toenail and periungual skin. The wound is then sutured.

intervention.description: Using local aneasthesia, resection of central part of toenail with germinal matrix.
Using local anaesthesia,we remove lateral part of toenail .

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patient with ingrown toenail
- Patients from 10 years up to 35 years
Exclusion Criteria:
- patients with concurrent toe deformity
- patients less than 10 years or more than 35 years

responsible_party.investigator_title: Assistant professour general surgery zagazig university Egypt
